metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3826 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c inlibiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service(segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-12 - 12-20220319-1ubuntu1
g++-12 - 12-20220319-1ubuntu1

criterions.comment: gcc-11 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-12 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12-20220319-1ubuntu1').
gdb package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.1-0ubuntu1~22.04').
binutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.37.90.20220126-0ubuntu1').
